location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 1112 from Charles Norris, Chief Secretary to Government, Bombay, to Samuel Hennell, Acting Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire

mods.abstract: In this letter, received 8 November 1834, Charles Norris, Chief Secretary to Government, Bombay, includes a copy of a letter from the Resident, David Anderson Blane, dated 3 July 1834, writing from on board the Amherstat sea, reporting on the unfavourable state of the affairs of His Highness the Imaum [Imam, Sa‘īd bin Sulṭān Āl Sa‘īd] of Muskat [Muscat] and on the details of interviews between Blane and the Regents of Muskat in His Highness's absence. Norris goes on to repeat sentiments expressed in his letter, no. 347, dated 7 March 1834 (see folios 1-5), which stated that the Government should not interfere in the affairs of the Imaum's Government. Blane's letter follows on from this letter.
